title: Welcome to ZeroCloud
contentHTML:
Welcome to ZeroCloud

Lightweight, privacy-first, and works fully offline.

Key features

  • Rich-text editor powered by Quill
  • Instant autosave to your browser (IndexedDB)
  • Sidebar with quick note switching
  • Clean typography with headings, bold, italic, and lists
  • Keyboard friendly: Esc closes dialogs

Tips

  • Use headings to structure your notes
  • Try bold/italic to emphasize ideas
  • Create lists for tasks and outlines

Enjoy your writing!

title: JSS small project
contentHTML:
JSS small project

This note mixes code and commentary. Below is a tiny JS snippet:

// A tiny state helper
function createStore(initial) {
  let state = initial;
  const subs = new Set();
  return {
    get: () => state,
    set: (next) => { state = next; subs.forEach(fn => fn(state)); },
    subscribe: (fn) => { subs.add(fn); return () => subs.delete(fn); }
  };
}

const store = createStore({ count: 0 });
store.subscribe(s => console.log('count =', s.count));
store.set({ count: 1 });

Explanation:

  1. createStore returns basic get/set/subscribe utilities.
  2. We can observe changes by subscribing to state updates.
  3. Great for experiments and tiny apps.

Next steps

  • Add persistence with localStorage or IndexedDB
  • Expose a simple API for UI components
  • Write a few unit tests

title: A long, regular note
contentHTML:
On Focus and Flow

Deep work requires time, intention, and the removal of distractions. When you settle into a focused block, your attention narrows and ideas start to connect more naturally.

Consistency matters more than intensity. Short, regular sessions compound into meaningful progress. A reliable routine is better than a heroic sprint.

Guidelines

  • Start with a small, clear objective
  • Remove the nearest distraction
  • Work in 25–50 minute intervals
  • Write down the next step before stopping

Progress often looks uneven—some days are fast, others slow. That is normal. Keep going, and prefer clarity over speed.

Closing thought

Write, revise, and repeat. Momentum grows with each pass.
